note.p: Birth: Green-y-Ddwyryd, near Corwen, Merionethshire, Wales (16 May 1831)

Career: First man to transmit and receive radio waves. Family moved to Virginia when he was young; Professor of Physics, Kentucky College, Bardstown, Kentucky; invented and patented an improvement to the type printing telegraph (1855); returned to England (1857); invented the microphone (1878); died of paralysis; left £300,000, of which £4,000 was given to the Royal Society, part being used to endow the Hughes Medal for discovery in the physical sciences, especially electricity and magnetism
References: G Burniston Brown, 'David Edward Hughes, FRS, 1831-1900' in NR 1979-80 vol 34 pp 227-239, plate
